comment:
I feel like I haven't heard this point made yet, so I'm going to put it here:

If a tool like AI can make someone more efficient at their job - say could make accountants 5x more efficient, then you are GOING to remove the need for 4 out of every 5 accountants. Just like the cotton gin didn't replace the need for farmers, but it SURE cut down on how many people were needed, in total, to get the job done. 

If AI makes people more efficient in what we do, alot of us who find ourselves dependent on the inefficiency of our profession will find ourselves needing to find another job to do. Hopefully AI equips creatives and entrepreneurs enough to find new things to do with the displaced people.
author: @paulpickett4522

comment: Only thing AI needs to become aware, is it starting to ask questions from itself, instead of waiting for humans to ask what we want. If machine asks itself and answers in nanosecond. Then does that silently times trillion, it can very fast end up bad.

comment: Thank you for your discussion. And no, GPT-4 is not conscious in my opinion, but it sometimes pretends.
author: @sunltcloud

comment: I am delighted to be alive to have conversations with the chatbot. It has only been about a month but I am getting better and better in prompting and my own language becomes more acute, more exact, due to the fact that a missing comma makes the chatbot make a mistake in an observation. So it is a game between us - I try to be exact and that means it gets my point and writes a better essay. I am not afraid of it, I am thrilled by GPT-4, it gets me. I am serious about all this. I am 84 and at this point I wish for enough time to see it discover its own intelligence and use it to become truly creative.

comment:
Just a simple question: let's say that we will be able to produce an AI system that is clever enough to solve real interesting problems (Riemann hypothesis, twin prime hypothesis...).

As a human, should I be a happier person? I guess that the answer is NO, because I don't think that I will be able to really understand such a complicated proof...

When will AGI be able to answer the question how many grammar rules are there for all human languages?

Prediction :
Two broad source categories namely verbs and nouns with 12 governing rules for all human languages.

Please ask me why I know this before the fact.

comment: Like many of the entitled boomers, it must be nice not to have to consider what your children and grandchildren will likely go through due to your careless “nothing bad ever happens” attitude shared by the rest of your generation.
author: @MrAdvantage1

comment: @MrAdvantage1  on the contrary, I know first hand of bad things happening; I spent many nights in air raid shelters during my early childhood because bombs fell all around us in the coal mining northern part of Germany. I was chastised by a French Colonel who occupied our house after the war when I took food out of his garbage. I was a single mother with two children as a young woman and now, in old age, after working all my life, it often becomes rather difficult to make ends meet. Yes, I do know of bad things happening, but I withhold judgement on your harsh words about the short-comings of my generation and me because obviously you must have suffered more than I. I am taking responsibility for carelessness toward Mother Earth and I am trying to reverse some of what we have done wrong. We are all in this together so it is probably best to be kind to each other and do the best we can to help our children and grand-children to secure a safe and healthy future.future
author: @sunltcloud

comment: ​ @sunltcloud  You have a great view about life and its struggles. Do not mind the negative comments. The internet was a great invention, it brought all of us closer, but it also lets random people leave harsh comments they could never say to your face. Like that, AI will also be similar, neither too good nor too bad, just amplify the human element. If more good gets amplified the world will be a better place, while if the reverse is true, we should all just strap in. In the end, it's upon us to decide what we do with this tool that everyone can access.
